casebody.data:
Frank Paul FERRARA, Petitioner-Appellant, v. Ronald ANGELONE, Director, Department of Corrections, Respondent-Appellee. No. 00-7275. United States Court of Appeals, Fourth Circuit. Submitted Jan. 11, 2001. Decided Jan. 17, 2001. Frank Paul Ferrara, pro se. Donald Eldridge Jeffrey, III, Office of the Attorney General of Virginia, Richmond, VA, for appellee.

Before NIEMEYER, WILLIAMS, and KING, Circuit JJ.

PER CURIAM.

Frank Paul Ferrara seeks to appeal the district court’s order denying relief on his petition filed under 28 U.S.C.A. § 2254 (West 1994 & Supp.2000). We have reviewed the record and the district court’s opinion accepting the recommendation of the magistrate judge and find no reversible error. Accordingly, we deny a certificate of appealability and dismiss the appeal on the reasoning of the district court. Ferrara v. Angelone, No. CA-99-1401-2 (E.D.Va. Aug. 2, 2000). We dispense with oral argument because the facts and legal contentions are adequately presented in the materials before the court and argument would not aid the decisional process.

DISMISSED.
